hypotheses.name: Paint-sealed sash
hypotheses.description: Paint or caulk has sealed sash to frame.

tests.question: Run a thin blade along sash edges — does it lift free easily?

hypotheses.fix: Score paint seal with utility knife; gently free sash along edges.

hypotheses.name: Warped or swollen wood
hypotheses.description: Wooden sash expanded due to humidity or heat.

tests.question: After freeing edges, does window move but scrape heavily?

hypotheses.fix: Sand binding surfaces and repaint; manage indoor humidity.

hypotheses.name: Broken sash cord or spring balance

tests.question: Does the sash drop when released, as if no support?
supports: Broken sash cord or spring balance

hypotheses.fix: Replace sash cord or spring balance assembly.

hypotheses.name: Track obstruction
hypotheses.description: Debris or protruding screws block sash movement.

tests.question: Look along tracks — do you see dirt or screws blocking the path?

hypotheses.fix: Remove obstruction; clean track; ensure screws flush with frame.

safety_checks: Do not force the sash if it resists strongly — glass may shatter.
Wear gloves when cutting paint seal.
Support sash with hand if it may fall unexpectedly.
